paper_abstract: Let G = (V, E) be a simple graph of order n with V(G) = {v(1), v(2), ..., v(n)} and degree sequence d(1), d(2), ..., d(n) Let rho(G) be the largest eigenvalue of adjacency matrix of G, and let E(G) be the energy of G. Denote ((alpha)t)(i) = Sigma(i similar to j) d(j)(alpha) and ((alpha)m)(i) = ((alpha)t)i/d(i)(alpha), where alpha is a real number. In this paper, we obtain two sharp bounds on rho(G) in terms of ((alpha)m)(i) or ((alpha)t)(i), respectively. Also, we present some sharp bounds on the energy E(G). From which, we can derive some known results.
paper_title: Sharp bounds on the spectral radius and the energy of graphs
